column4: you downloaded and extracted a file in order to install xmms?
that is a method of last resort only
that is the source code.  you want to install an ubuntu binary.  you can install xmms from a terminal with 'apt-get install xmms'  or use synaptic.
you need to try again.  you didn't make it clear what happened.  use your password.  if it doesn't work you have to say more---say the error message.
i did use my pass and exactly NOTHING happend . it just resumed to the state it was before (it was showing the present location I was in i.e. desktop/xmms ...... )
'sudo apt-get install xmms', see if nothing happens again
denix@mrdenix:~/Desktop/xmms-1.2.10$ sudo su apt -get install xmms
and you are entering denix' password?
only if you kept the window open or your irc client kept a log
is this the only user account on the system?
you're welcome.  the -r is for restart actually.  -h is full shutdown.
instead of now how can write an atribute  for a specific time (i.e. shutdown in 60 s)
in that exampple the [-t sec]  is where you can put the amount of time to WAIT before doing it, or you can put the exact actual time where it says time
